alert.note: Alert for Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:34PM EDT until June 29 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT/445 PM EDT/ FOR EAST CENTRAL WHITE...SOUTHWESTERN WABASH... WARRICK...VANDERBURGH...GIBSON...POSEY AND SOUTHEASTERN PIKE COUNTIES... At 333 PM CDT/433 PM EDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Tell City to Eureka to New Harmony, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Evansville, Princeton, Mount Vernon, Boonville, Newburgh, Chandler, Fort Branch, Melody Hill, Haubstadt, Darmstadt, Owensville, Poseyville, Lynnville, New Harmony, Cynthiana, Folsomville, Blairsville, Kasson, Elberfeld and Somerville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 1 and 31. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 2 and 53. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
